A single cloud can weigh more than 1 million pounds.
A shrimp's heart is in its head.
It is physically impossible for pigs to look up into the sky.
The 'M' in M&M's stands for 'Mars' and 'Murrie'.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out.
The electric chair was invented by a dentist.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
A blue whale's heart is so big, a human can swim through its arteries.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
A bolt of lightning is six times hotter than the sun.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died.
A snail can sleep for three years.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the known universe.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
The 20th-century Scottish poet, Hugh MacDiarmid, tried to invent a synthetic language that would be a perfect blend of all the world's languages.
The first-ever VCR, which was made in 1956, was the size of a piano.
A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
The state of Florida is larger than England.
It's possible to lead a cow upstairs... but not downstairs.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
The ampersand symbol (&) is a ligature of the letters 'e' and 't', which is 'et' in Latin, meaning 'and'.
The first orange wasn't orange.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
A chicken once lived for 18 months without a head.
The national animal of Australia, the kangaroo, is unable to walk backwards.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion scents.
The 'sixth sick sheik's sixth sheep's sick' is believed to be the toughest tongue twister in the English language.
A baby octopus is about the size of a flea when it is born.
It is impossible for most people to lick their own elbow.
The moon has moonquakes.
A rhinoceros' horn is made of hair.
The longest English word is 189,819 letters long.
It's illegal to own just one guinea pig in Switzerland because they get lonely.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer.
A flea can jump 350 times its body length.
A cat has 32 muscles in each ear.
The dot over the letter 'i' is called a tittle.
A human's teeth are just as strong as a shark's teeth.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
A group of porcupines is called a prickle.

The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in their lifetime.

The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in 'If I Ran the Zoo'.
